page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: There are some cottages and houses in Podington and Hinwick that date back to the 16th & l7th centuries. Most of these have thatched roofs. A lot of the more isolated cottages are now empty and derelict. There are a few empty houses in Hinwick. Most of the houses date back to the 19th century. Some of the houses have date stones in the walls. Near the school there are a few council houses which were built in the l930's and some built in the late l940's. At the bottom of Gold Street there are about 4 houses built since the fifties and two more near Corner Close. In Hinwick there is a new bungalow. Thirteen new houses were built in Hornbeam Close in the l960's and a new police house was built next to the school. Lots of houses have been made bigger by extending or combining.
